revolt verb
(PROTEST)
C2 [ I ] If a large number of people revolt, they refuse to be controlled or ruled, and take action against authority, often violent action: The people revolted against foreign rule and established their own government. Synonym
rise (BE OPPOSED TO)

revolt verb
(UNPLEASANT FEELING)
C2 [ T ] to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted: We were revolted by the dirt and mess in her house. It revolts me to know that the world spends so much money on arms when millions are dying of hunger. Synonyms
disgust
